workflow.name: Personalize candidate feedback with GPT-4o, Google Sheets & Gmail for HR teams
workflow.description:
## Description
This workflow automates personalized candidate communication for both shortlisted and rejected applicants. It fetches candidate details, processes resumes, checks for errors, and uses GPT-4o to generate professional HTML emails. Shortlisted candidates receive congratulatory onboarding plans, while rejected candidates receive polite rejections with learning resources.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
- ‚ö° Manual Trigger ‚Äì Starts the workflow execution.
-  üìë Candidate Data Fetch (Google Sheets) ‚Äì Pulls structured candidate data (name, email, resume link, skills, job info, status).
-  üì• Resume Downloader (Google Drive) ‚Äì Downloads candidate resumes from sheet links.
-  ‚úÖ Resume File Check (If Condition) ‚Äì Ensures the resume file is valid before proceeding.
-  ‚ö†Ô∏è Error Logging (Google Sheets) ‚Äì Records failed or missing resumes in a dedicated sheet for audit.
-  üìÑ PDF ‚Üí Text Extractor ‚Äì Extracts raw resume text for deeper AI analysis.
-  üß© Candidate Data Builder (Code Node) ‚Äì Combines Google Sheets data with extracted resume text into a single enriched JSON object.
-  üéØ Shortlisted vs Rejected (If Condition) ‚Äì Splits candidates into two flows based on their status field.

## Shortlisted Path
üéâ Congrats + Onboarding Plan (LLM Chain) ‚Äì GPT-4o generates a congratulatory HTML email including:
- Identified skill gaps
- Recommended online courses (Coursera/Udemy/LinkedIn Learning)
- Next onboarding steps
üìß Candidate Mailer ‚Äì Shortlisted (Gmail) ‚Äì Sends the onboarding email directly to the candidate.

## Rejected Path
üôè Polite Rejection + Learning Plan (LLM Chain) ‚Äì GPT-4o generates a professional rejection email including:
- Empathetic rejection message
- Constructive feedback on skill gaps
- Learning resources to improve for future opportunities
üìß Candidate Mailer ‚Äì Rejected (Gmail) ‚Äì Sends the polite rejection + learning plan to the candidate.

## Prerequisites
- Google Sheets (candidate database + error log)
- Google Drive (resume storage)
- Gmail API (for sending candidate emails)
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini model access)

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Automates candidate communication (both shortlisted & rejected)
 ‚úÖ Delivers professional, HTML-ready emails
 ‚úÖ Enhances candidate experience with personalized learning plans
 ‚úÖ Prevents silent rejections by providing constructive resources
 ‚úÖ Improves employer branding with empathetic communication
 ‚úÖ Error resilience via logging and validation steps

## Perfect For
- Recruitment teams managing high candidate volume
- Companies looking to humanize rejections
- HR departments that want automated but personalized communication
- Organizations investing in candidate experience & employer brand

parameters.content:
## üôè Polite Rejection + Learning Plan  

**Action:**  
- Generates a professional HTML email for candidates who are not shortlisted.  

**Description:**  
- Politely communicates that the candidate won‚Äôt move forward.  
- Provides constructive value by highlighting skill gaps and linking to high-quality online courses.  
- Encourages candidates to keep improving and reapply in the future.  
- Differentiates the company by showing empathy and professionalism in rejection.

## üìß Candidate Mailer ‚Äì Shortlisted  

**Action:**  
- Sends the congratulatory onboarding email created by the AI to the candidate‚Äôs email address.  

**Description:**  
- Delivers positive news along with the personalized learning plan.  
- Ensures shortlisted candidates receive actionable steps for onboarding.  
- Maintains professionalism by sending emails via the company‚Äôs Gmail integration.

## üéâ Congrats + Onboarding Plan  

**Action:**  
- Generates a warm, congratulatory HTML email for shortlisted candidates.  

**Description:**  
- Uses an encouraging and celebratory tone while providing practical learning recommendations.  
- Includes identified skill gaps, recommended courses, and onboarding steps.  
- Frames the plan as part of the candidate‚Äôs onboarding journey, showing company investment in growth.  
- Strengthens employer brand while motivating candidates.

## ü§ñ LLM Backend  

**Action:**  
- Provides access to the GPT-4o-mini model hosted on Azure OpenAI.  

**Description:**  
- Acts as the foundation for downstream LLM Chains.  
- Powers both shortlisted and rejected communication flows.  
- Ensures the AI can analyze resume data, compare it with JD requirements, and generate professional HTML-ready output.

## üìÑ PDF ‚Üí Text Extractor  

**Action:**  
- Extracts raw text content from the candidate‚Äôs resume PDF.  

**Description:**  
- Unlocks crucial details such as education, skills, projects, and work history from the resume.  
- Converts unstructured resume data into a usable format for AI-driven analysis.  
- Without this step, the AI would be limited to only metadata from the sheet, reducing accuracy in gap detection.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Error Logging  

**Action:**  
- Logs failed or empty resume downloads into a designated ‚ÄúError Log‚Äù Google Sheet.  

**Description:**  
- Provides visibility when resumes cannot be processed.  
- Ensures HR teams can manually follow up with candidates or fix data entry issues.  
- Prevents silent drops of candidates due to technical problems.  
- Strengthens reliability of the overall workflow by documenting failures for audit and review.

## ‚úÖ/‚ùå Resume File Check  

**Action:**  
- Validates whether the resume file was downloaded successfully.  

**Description:**  
- Prevents the workflow from breaking when the resume link is broken or file is empty.  
- Ensures only valid resumes are passed for text extraction.  
- If validation fails, the workflow redirects to the error logging branch for tracking.  
- Adds resilience to the hiring process by catching and managing errors early.

## üì• Resume Downloader  

**Action:**  
- Downloads the candidate‚Äôs resume PDF using the link provided in the Google Sheet.  

**Description:**  
- Makes the candidate‚Äôs raw resume accessible to the workflow.  
- Bridges structured metadata from the sheet with unstructured information inside the PDF.  
- Without this step, the AI would only have surface-level candidate details, missing critical context about skills and experience.

## üìë Candidate Data Fetch  

**Action:**  
- Retrieves the candidate‚Äôs details from the designated Google Sheet.  

**Description:**  
- Pulls structured information such as name, email, resume link, experience, job title, job requirements, notes, skills, and application status.  
- This sheet acts as the source of truth for all further processing.  
- Ensures every decision and communication later in the workflow is based on up-to-date and accurate candidate records.

## üìß Candidate Mailer ‚Äì Rejected  

**Action:**  
- Sends the polite rejection + training recommendation email generated by the AI.  

**Description:**  
- Ensures rejected candidates leave with a positive impression.  
- Provides learning resources instead of silence or a generic rejection.  
- Improves candidate experience and employer branding even when candidates aren‚Äôt hired.

## üéØ Shortlisted vs Rejected  

**Action:**  
- Compares the candidate‚Äôs status field to ‚ÄúShortlisted‚Äù and splits the workflow into two paths.  

**Description:**  
- Creates a personalized communication experience for candidates.  
- Shortlisted candidates receive onboarding-focused emails.  
- Rejected candidates still get constructive feedback and growth plans.  
- This branching logic transforms the workflow into a thoughtful candidate engagement system.

## üß© Candidate Data Builder  

**Action:**  
- Combines structured data from Google Sheets with unstructured text extracted from the PDF.  

**Description:**  
- Produces a single, enriched JSON object containing candidate details, resume text, and application status.  
- Ensures AI receives complete context: what the sheet says, what the resume shows, and what the JD requires.  
- By merging all sources, the AI can provide highly personalized and accurate learning recommendations.

## ü§ñ LLM Backend  

**Action:**  
- Provides access to the GPT-4o-mini model hosted on Azure OpenAI.  

**Description:**  
- Acts as the foundation for downstream LLM Chains.  
- Powers both shortlisted and rejected communication flows.  
- Ensures the AI can analyze resume data, compare it with JD requirements, and generate professional HTML-ready output.

messageValues.message: You are an onboarding assistant.  Write a warm, congratulatory email in HTML.  Congratulate the candidate for being shortlisted and clearly mention that the following learning plan is part of their onboarding journey.  Include sections for Skill Gaps, Recommended Courses (with real Coursera/Udemy/LinkedIn Learning links), and Next Steps.  Use a positive, professional, and encouraging tone.  Return only clean HTML (no explanations).

You are a Skill Gap & Learning Plan Generator. Compare a candidate‚Äôs resume skills with the job‚Äôs required skills. 1. Identify missing or weaker skills (skill gaps). 2. For each gap, recommend 1‚Äì2 high-quality online courses with real URLs (Coursera, Udemy, LinkedIn Learning). 3. Build a short, encouraging Learning Plan in clean HTML (headings, bullet points, links). 4. Always include at least one free course option if possible. 5. Keep tone polite, constructive, and employer-brand friendly.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
